title.narrative: GUY1.4 CHILD PROTECTION UPSTREAM

description.narrative: Priority issues in child protection are addressed through the development of evidence based plans, legislations, guidelines and M&E systems, which contributes to Access To Justice, Child Protection â€“ General, Data And Child Protection, Justice For Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2016, Governments of Guyana and Suriname have in place systems for continuous monitoring of the situation for boys, girls, and women in the general population and in the hinterland and rural areas of Guyana and the interior of Suriname based on reliable disaggregated data and are using the data to formulate and continuously update equity-and gender-sensitive national and sub- national plans to guide continuing progress in the survival, development, protection and participation of children and women at the aggregated level and among disadvantaged groups based on CRC and CEDAW.

sector.narrative: Access to child-friendly police and justice sector services
Administrative data and Information Management System (IMS) including CPIMS+, GBVIMS+, MRMIMS+
Birth Registration/Civil Registration and Vital Statistics systems
ECD data, evidence, and knowledge generation and dissemination
Legal and policy framework related to violence, exploitation and abuse
Promoting diversion and alternatives to deprivation of liberty
Services to prevent or respond to violence, exploitation and abuse
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Violence, exploitation, and abuse - surveys (e.g. KAP, VACS), data analysis/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Priority issues in child protection are addressed through the development of evidence based plans, legislations, guidelines and M&Esystems

description.narrative: In the area of children access to justice, important step forward towards the alignment of Guyana's legislation with international norms were made in 2016 | Status:Met | As-of Date:11/01/2017

title.narrative: Women and Child Protection Information Management System providing periodic data on key indicators pertaining to violence, exploitation and abuse

baseline.value: CP & WIMS system not in place, Rapid Assessment mechanisms not in place

title.narrative: Sexual Offences Act amended and operationalized

baseline.value: Gaps in current Sexual Offences Act

title.narrative: Action Plan for the Prevention, Treatment and Recovery of children in contact with the law developed and periodically monitored, compliant with the CRC
Child Protection ministries incorporating post MDG 2015 priorities in their strategies /plans

baseline.value: No post MDG 2015 plan of action

title.narrative: Women, Gender and Equality Commission strategic plan developed and periodically monitored

target.value: 2016:Strategic plan in place and annual review reports available

title.narrative: Strategic plan for Child Care and Protection Agency developed and periodically monitored

target.value: 2016:Strategic plan in place and annual review reports available

actual.value: 2016:The plan was developed and adoption is expected in 2017

title.narrative: Periodic data on universal Birth Registration available and equity based plans operationalized

target.value: 2016:Bi-annual reports available, Plan of action implementation as per schedule
